solution_line_template: The total number of candies Shelley had before eating some is {candies_left_after_eating} + {candies_eaten_previous_week} = <<{candies_left_after_eating}+{candies_eaten_previous_week}={candies_before_eating}>>{candies_before_eating} candies.
When her friend came over, she brought {friend_multiplier}*{candies_before_eating} = <<{friend_multiplier}*{candies_before_eating}={friend_brought_candies}>>{friend_brought_candies} candies.

The total number of candies in the bowl is now {friend_brought_candies}+{candies_left_after_eating}= <<{friend_brought_candies}+{candies_left_after_eating}={total_candies_in_bowl}>>{total_candies_in_bowl} candies.
When they divide this equally between them, each gets {total_candies_in_bowl}/{number_of_people} = <<{total_candies_in_bowl}/{number_of_people}={candies_per_person}>>{candies_per_person} candies.

When Shelly's friend eats {friend_eats_candies} of her candies, she still has {candies_per_person}-{friend_eats_candies} = <<{candies_per_person}-{friend_eats_candies}={friend_candies_remaining}>>{friend_candies_remaining} candies.
